result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Louis M Felerski

records.addlTxt:
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. 
Defendant Louis M Felerski not in court, in custody.  Attorney Anthony D Cotton appeared by video for Louis M Felerski.  Attorney Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense acknowledges receipt of discovery and requests additional time to review materials with client.  No objection from the State.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Attorney Theodore Kafkas

Defendant Louis M Felerski appeared by video, in custody in HOC. Attorney John Binder appeared by video on behalf of Attorney Anthony D Cotton for Louis M Felerski.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver

Defendant Louis M Felerski not in court, in custody in HOC.  Attorney Anthony D Cotton not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Defense Counsel requests an adjournment since being newly appointed to the case. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

-received and filed. 
Attorney Anthony D. Cotton.

Adjustment Number: 22A 081831,
Payable Number: 1028311,
Receipt Number: 22RP034375,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Louis M Felerski not in court, defendant in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.   If an Electronic Monitoring Device (GPS) is unavailable and Cash Bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the Electronic Monitoring (GPS) waiting list.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Defendant to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Louis M Felerski in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant Louis M Felerski in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Louis M Felerski appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 1 and 2. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with DAF (d.o.b. 3/10/66); MMF (d.o.b. 8/13/61)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
